content:
User interface design
---------------------

The Annotation screen is designed to be user-friendly and efficient for Tagger and Checker users. It has the following features:

* Document preview: A large preview of the document that displays the labels that have been placed on the document.
* Classification dropdown: A dropdown that allows Tagger users to select the classification for the document.
* Labels list: A list of labels that is relevant for the selected classification. Tagger users can select labels from this list and place them on the document.
* Label tools: Tools that allow Tagger users to adjust the position, size, and shape of the labels, and edit the name and description of the labels.
* Color picker: A color picker that allows Tagger users to change the color of the labels.
* Save button: A button that allows Tagger users to save their annotation progress.
* Approve/reject buttons: Buttons that allow Checker users to approve or reject each label.
* Modify button: A button that allows Checker users to edit the labels.
* Comment field: A field that allows Tagger and Checker users to add comments for each label.
* Page number and total number of pages: Displays the page number and total number of pages in the document.
* Page navigation buttons: Buttons that allow Tagger and Checker users to navigate between pages in the document.
* Document outline: A list of headings and pages in the document that allows Tagger and Checker users to quickly jump to specific parts of the document.
* Annotation history: A list that displays the history of changes for each label on the document.

User interface layout
---------------------

The Annotation screen has the following layout:

* The document preview is displayed at the top of the screen, taking up most of the space.
* The classification dropdown and labels list are displayed on the left side of the screen.
* The label tools, color picker, and save button are displayed below the document preview.
* The approve/reject buttons and modify button are displayed below the document preview on the right side of the screen.
* The comment field is displayed below the document preview on the right side of the screen.
* The page number and total number of pages are displayed at the bottom of the screen.
* The page navigation buttons are displayed at the bottom of the screen on the left side.
* The document outline is displayed on the right side of the screen.
* The annotation history is displayed in a popup when the user clicks on a label.
